definition: to issue (an order, decree etc)/to send out/to dispatch/to produce (a sound)/to let out (a laugh)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: The crowd greeted the performers with boos and hiss es.
sentences.chinese: 观众向演出者发出一片嘘声。

sentences.english: Don't make any noise while the baby is sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 孩子睡觉时别发出任何声音。

sentences.english: The antibodies have been altered to fluoresce under certain conditions.
sentences.chinese: 在一定条件下，这些抗体被变成能发出荧光。

sentences.english: The rain drummed loudly on the metal roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨点敲击金属屋顶，发出很大的声响。

sentences.english: On summer evenings the flowers gave forth an almost intoxicating scent.
sentences.chinese: 夏夜，花朵发出几乎醉人的芳香。

sentences.english: The sound spelled "miaow" is used only in talking to people.
sentences.chinese: 发出的“喵喵声”只在与人讲话时使用。

sentences.english: He was snapped making sure the windows were sparkling by a resident in a neighbouring apartment block.
sentences.chinese: 他烦恼一定是邻近公寓楼的住户让窗玻璃发出闪光。

sentences.english: That mixture is enough to move his jeep; however, whenever the car moves, it exhales food smell.
sentences.chinese: 当车子开动时，总是会散发出食物的味道。

sentences.english: The applicants who pass the qualification pre-evaluation will receive the formal invitation for Levy.
sentences.chinese: 主办单位向资审合格的应征人发出正式邀请。

sentences.english: The whales expired with a rushing sound.
sentences.chinese: 那些鲸鱼呼气时发出一种急促的声音。

sentences.english: With 11)rustling feathers, they swam lightly over the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们轻飘飘地浮在水上，羽毛发出飕飕的响声。

sentences.english: But they were uttered only within his imagination.
sentences.chinese: 其实只是在他的想象之中发出了声。

sentences.english: Tritium emits a weak form of radiation that does not travel very far in the air and cannot penetrate the skin.
sentences.chinese: 氚发出的辐射很弱，在空气传播不远，不能穿透皮肤。

sentences.english: A slight, metallic sound, as of coins rattling in a pocket.
sentences.chinese: 叮铛声一种象口袋中硬币碰撞发出轻微。

sentences.english: Data events are used to emit additional data information.
sentences.chinese: 数据事件被用于发出额外的数据信息。

definition: (of a sound) to come through/to be heard/(of news) to arrive
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)

to put out/to come up with/to make (a choice, decision, proposal, response, comment etc)/to issue (a permit, statement, explanation, apology, reassurance to the public etc)/to draw (conclusion)/to deliver (speech, judgment)/to devise (explanation)/to extract

up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly
